answers.answer: Many women develop thyroidits (goiter and swelling) after giving birth and it usually resolves itself, but sometimes it doesn't. In my case, after I gave birth I developed Hashimoto's thyroiditis. I take thyroid medication that has shrunk my nodules/goiter.So no depression, constipation, diarrhea, fatigue, weight gain, depression, anxiety, weight loss, trembling hands, leg pains, arthritis like swelling or pain in joints?These symptoms are signs of thyroid disease.When we discovered I had nodules, the soonest my endocrinologist could see me for an ultrasound was two weeks. My nodules were biopsied and discovered to be benign. Most nodules are benign, but in the rare event they are cancerous, thyroid cancer has a very high cure rate.The best type of doctor to examine nodules would be an endocrinologist, but one who specializes in thyroid, not diabetes.Take care...:) Tamra
